meanings.definition: A poem in which all the lines have the same end rhyme.
meanings.sent1: The monorhyme was easy to spot in the poem.
meanings.sent2: The poet used monorhyme to create a rhythmic pattern.
meanings.sent3: The monorhyme made the poem sound like a song.
meanings.sent4: Her monorhyme echoed through the room, captivating everyone.
meanings.sent5: The monorhyme added a musical quality to the verses.

meanings.definition: To write or compose in monorhyme.
meanings.sent1: She decided to monorhyme her next poem.
meanings.sent2: He enjoys monorhyming his verses for fun.
meanings.sent3: They challenged each other to monorhyme competitions.
meanings.sent4: His words monorhymed effortlessly, flowing like a river.
meanings.sent5: The poet's ability to monorhyme amazed his audience.
